product_snapshot.description: Mobile app for menstrual cycle, ovulation, pregnancy tracking with AI insights on symptoms, mood.
product_snapshot.target_user: Menstruating pre-menopausal women for cycle education, contraception, conception.
product_snapshot.actual_job_to_be_done: Provides self-understanding of hormonal health via data logging and AI education.

founders.name: Yuri Gurski (CEO)
founders.background: Tech entrepreneur from Belarus, mobile app development.
founders.relevant_lived_experience: Observed gaps in women's digital health tools; team likely included health experts.
founders.founder_motivation: Frustration with inaccurate, fragmented cycle tracking solutions.

core_pain_problem.problem_statement: Lack of reliable, personalized tools for cycle/symptom tracking and health insights amid misinformation.
core_pain_problem.who_experienced_it: Menstruating women with cycle irregularities or fertility needs.
core_pain_problem.why_existing_solutions_failed: Basic calendars lacked AI depth; data-sharing privacy risks.
core_pain_problem.emotional_or_practical_cost: Anxiety from unpredictability, undetected health issues.

world_state.social_cultural: Destigmatization of women's health post-#MeToo; normalized cycle discussions.
world_state.economic: Healthtech VC boom 2014-2018; low-cost dev in Belarus.
world_state.user_behavior: Rise of quantified self; daily app logging for personal data.
world_state.demographic: Millennial/Gen Z delaying childbirth, needing fertility tools.
world_state.anthropological_psychological: Demand for body literacy and control over 'invisible' biology.
world_state.technological: Smartphone AI/ML for cycle predictions post-2014.

competitive_landscape.incumbent_failures: No personalization/education; privacy breaches via SDKs.
competitive_landscape.user_tradeoffs_before: Inaccurate tracking, no symptom insights, high privacy risks.

differentiation.core_insight: Cycles enable AI-driven education beyond calendars.
differentiation.assumptions_rejected: Need for medical gatekeepers; went direct-to-consumer.
differentiation.meaningful_differences: Holistic symptom tracking + 88.98% user knowledge gains.

fundamental_human_need.why_it_mattered_then: Social media amplified health ignorance; empowerment trends heightened need.

success_synthesis.why_it_worked: Outlasted rivals via education + AI timing amid femtech rise.
success_synthesis.key_alignment_factors: Psych control needs, mobile AI, millennial habits, cultural openness.
success_synthesis.historical_inevitability_thesis: Natural smartphone extension for cycle self-tracking.
